title: Count Numbers Smaller Than Each Element
content:
You are provided with an array called nums. For each element nums[i], determine how many elements in the same array are less than nums[i]. Specifically, calculate the count of indices j such that j is not equal to i and nums[j] is less than nums[i].

Return the results in a new array.

testCases.description: In the array, nums[0]=8 has four elements smaller than itself (1, 2, 2, 3). nums[1]=1 has zero smaller elements. nums[2]=2 and nums[3]=2 each have one smaller element (1). nums[4]=3 has three smaller elements (1, 2, 2).
In the array, nums[0]=6 has two elements smaller than itself (5, 4). nums[1]=5 has one smaller element (4). nums[2]=4 has no smaller elements. nums[3]=8 has three smaller elements (6, 5, 4).
All elements are equal in the array, so there are no smaller elements for any index.

inputFormat:
```
A single line containing integers representing the array nums, separated by spaces.
```
outputFormat: Print the resulting sequence of integers separated by single spaces, where each integer represents the count of smaller numbers for the corresponding element in the input.
